1. Braveheart (1995))
A historical epic about William Wallace, a Scottish nobleman, who leads his country in the war for independence against England. Starring Gerard McSorley, David O'Hara, Angus Macfadyen, Catherine McCormack, Michael Byrne, Brendan Gleeson, Mhairi Calvey, Patrick McGoohan, Patrick McGoohan.
2. The Deer Hunter (1978))
A drama about two friends from the same small town in Pennsylvania: John Hunter (played by Robert De Niro)) and his best friend Mike Corcoran (played by James Robinson)). Their friendship is tested when both men are deployed to fight in the Vietnam War. When John returns home a year later with a heavy metal leg, he struggles to come to terms with what has happened to him. Meanwhile, Mike is married to a beautiful woman named Emily who works as a nurse at the same hospital where Mike works as a security guard. However, when Emily starts having serious symptoms related to pregnancy complications like gestational diabetes mellitus (GDMM) or pre-eclampsia (PECLAM)), Emily tells her husband Mike about it. But Mike is not very confident about treating Emily's pregnancy-related complications like GDMM or PECLAM). But Mike wants to do everything he can to help his wife Emily as much as possible to try and make things work out for her.
